faqs.question: Hur mycket kostar denna fastighet?
faqs.answer: €310,000. This represents exceptional value for a 3-bedroom villa on 850m² in Fuente Álamo, priced 21% below the local market average. Flexible payment plans and mortgage options are available for qualifying buyers.

faqs.question: Kan utlänningar köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Yes, absolutely. Foreign nationals—including UK citizens, EU residents, and non-EU buyers—have equal property purchase rights in Spain. No special permits or residency requirements apply. The process is straightforward, particularly when working with established real estate professionals familiar with international purchases.

faqs.question: Vilka är kostnaderna för att köpa fastighet i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs typically include 6-8% property transfer tax (ITP), legal fees (€1,000-2,000), notary fees (€500-1,000), and registration costs (€200-400). First-time EU buyers may qualify for tax reductions. Our team provides complete cost breakdowns before you commit.

faqs.question: Är Costa Blanca en bra plats att köpa fastighet?
faqs.answer: Excellent choice. Costa Blanca combines established expat communities, year-round sunshine, affordable living, proximity to quality healthcare and schools, and proven property appreciation. Over 300,000 British residents chose the region—for good reasons including strong rental markets and lifestyle quality.

faqs.question: Kan jag få ett bolån i Spanien som utlänning?
faqs.answer: Yes. Major Spanish banks and European lenders offer mortgages to non-residents at competitive rates (currently 3-4%). Typical terms provide 20-30 year mortgages covering 70-80% of property value. UK pension income and retirement status actually strengthen applications with many lenders.

faqs.question: Hur mycket är fastighetsskatten i Spanien?
faqs.answer: Annual property tax (IBI) averages €200-400 for properties like this villa, calculated on cadastral values rather than market price. This represents excellent value compared to UK council tax. Additional taxes apply only if you earn Spanish rental income (taxed at standard rates).

faqs.question: Hur är levnadskostnaderna på Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Significantly lower than northern Europe—typically 30-40% cheaper for groceries, utilities, and dining. Monthly living costs for families average €1,500-2,000 including housing, utilities, food, and activities. Healthcare and education for expats often cost less than home countries.

faqs.question: Is Costa Blanca good for families?
faqs.answer: Perfect for families. Multiple international schools operate throughout the region, safe communities welcome families, excellent healthcare is accessible, and outdoor activities (beaches, mountains, sports clubs) provide year-round entertainment. Thousands of families raise children successfully here.

faqs.question: How far is Fuente Álamo from beaches?
faqs.answer: Blue Flag beaches are 20-25 minutes away by car—close enough for regular weekend visits. Multiple beach towns offer different experiences, from family-friendly bays to water sports centers. School holidays often become beach adventures rather than special trips.

faqs.question: What is the weather like in Fuente Álamo?
faqs.answer: Exceptional. Over 300 days of sunshine annually with mild winters (average 15°C) and warm summers (30-35°C). The inland elevation provides relief from coastal heat. Winter months remain pleasant—rarely requiring heating. Climate supports outdoor family activities year-round.
